org.qcri.rheem.core.plan.rheemplan

Interface Operator

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ActualOperator, CompositeOperator, ExecutionOperator, GraphChiOperator, JavaExecutionOperator, SparkExecutionOperator
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BinaryToUnaryOperator, CartesianOperator, CollectionSource, CountOperator, DistinctOperator, FilterOperator, FlatMapOperator, GlobalReduceOperator, GraphChiPageRankOperator, GroupByOperator, JavaCartesianOperator, JavaCollectionSource, JavaCountOperator, JavaDistinctOperator, JavaFilterOperator, JavaFlatMapOperator, JavaGlobalReduceOperator, JavaJoinOperator, JavaLocalCallbackSink, JavaMapOperator, JavaMaterializedGroupByOperator, JavaObjectFileSink, JavaObjectFileSource, JavaReduceByOperator, JavaSortOperator, JavaTextFileSource, JavaTsvFileSink, JavaTsvFileSource, JavaUnionAllOperator, JoinOperator, LocalCallbackSink, MapOperator, MaterializedGroupByOperator, OperatorAlternative, OperatorBase, OperatorPattern, PageRankOperator, ReduceByOperator, ReduceOperator, SortOperator, SparkBroadcastOperator, SparkCartesianOperator, SparkCollectionSource, SparkCountOperator, SparkDistinctOperator, SparkFilterOperator, SparkFlatMapOperator, SparkGlobalReduceOperator, SparkJoinOperator, SparkLocalCallbackSink, SparkMapOperator, SparkMaterializedGroupByOperator, SparkObjectFileSink, SparkObjectFileSource, SparkReduceByOperator, SparkSortOperator, SparkTextFileSource, SparkTsvFileSink, SparkTsvFileSource, SparkUnionAllOperator, Subplan, SubplanPattern, TextFileSource, UnarySink, UnarySource, UnaryToUnaryOperator, UnionAllOperator

    public interface Operator
    An operator is any node that within a RheemPlan.

    An operator is basically determined by

    • its type,
    • its configuration,
    • its InputSlots, and
    • its OutputSlots.
    The former two aspects are handled by subclassed, the latter two are basic features of every operator.

    Slots are typed input and output declarations of each operator and can be connected to each other to form a full RheemPlan. Moreover, we distinguish between two kinds of InputSlots:

    1. Regular.Each operator will have set up these InputSlots already during its creation. They are indexed from 0 to the number of InputSlots - 1.
    2. Broadcast.Some operators permit for broadcast InputSlots. These are dynamically added and will be indexed after the regular ones. Also, their execution semantics differ: Broadcast input data will be provided before the regular data.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int FIRST_EPOCH
      Each operator is associated with an epoch, which is a logical timestamp for the operator's creation.

    • Field Detail

      • FIRST_EPOCH

        static final int FIRST_EPOCH
        Each operator is associated with an epoch, which is a logical timestamp for the operator's creation. This value is the lowest timestamp and default epoch.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • broadcastTo

        default void broadcastTo(int thisOutputIndex,
                         Operator that,
                         java.lang.String broadcastName)
        Connect an output of this operator as a broadcast input of a second operator.
        Parameters:
        thisOutputIndex - index of the output slot to connect to
        that - operator to connect to
        broadcastName - name of the broadcast that will be used by the operator to identify the broadcast; must be unique among all InputSlots
